page.title: 06CATTLE FARMING
page.content: Cattle are kept on the farms for about 18 months and are then sold at the livestock market in Abergele to lowland farmers who can fatten them for sale to the butcher more cheaply on their better land with a milder climate. The cattle, needing more and better food than the sheep, are kept on the lower fields which are more sheltered and have deeper soils. The area contains 45 working farms and a number of smallholdings. One of the farms in the area is 113 hectares: 97 hectares are improved grass; 8 hectares are used for fodder crops; 8 are rough grazing on the highest land. During May the farm had 325 ewes, 338 lambs and 93 cattle.
